title: Announcement, Lines: New Writing at the Detroit Institute of Arts, 1985
title_raw: Lines: New Writing at the Detroit Institute of Arts
signed: Signature imprinted in brown, lower right corner, running downward, sideways: Design: Edward Fella
inscribed:
Recto: Printed in dark pink and brown, upper left corner: November 1985/ LINES New Writing at The Detroit Institute of Arts presents:; across sheet in five text blocks: first text block: Sunday/* November 3 3:00p.m. Homage To Obsidian/ A cross-section of some of Detroit's most exciting Afro-American writers...[Lists writers who will read from their works, in tribute to the ten-year anniversary of Obsidian.  Gives, location, admission fee, additional information.]; second text block: Tuesday/* Novemener 12 7:30 p.m. An Evening With Richard Ellman features the renowned James Joyce biographer and scholar...[Describes event, gives biographical information of Ellman, location, admission fee.]; third text block: Sunday/* November 17 3:00 p.m. Films on Poetry Four short films on or by authors who have profoundly affected 20th century poetic practice...[Lists films, authors, locaion, admission fee.]; fourth text block: December 1985/ Sunday/* December 1 3:00 p.m. "Narration in film and Literature" a lecture by Robert Burgoyne... [Gives biographical information of Burgoyne, location, admission fee.]; fifth text block: Wednseday/ December 18 Jackson Mac Low (poet, composer, playwright, performance artist)...[Gives biographical information of Low, describes events, gives locations, admission fees.]; in dark pink, across right edge: L i N e S; in brown, across right edge, running downward, sideways: Open Field Series National Writers Series Open Field Series Open Field Series National Writer Series; in dark pink and brown across lower edge: The Open Field Series is made possible by a grant from the Michigan Foundation for the Arts.  For Information call LINES: 833-1858. 
Verso: Imprinted in brown diagonally from center to upper edge, running upward: NOVEMBER 1985 Sunday/* November 3 Open Field Series HOMAGE TO OBSIDIAN... [Lists events, dates.]... JACKSON MAC LOW; across lower left quadrant: The Detroit Institute of Arts/ 5200 Woodward Avenue/ Detroit, MI 48202; across lower right quadrant: Non-Profit Organization/ U.S. Postage/ Paid/ Founders Society/ Detroit Institute of Arts

*The "/" is included in the text.
description:
Poster/ announcement printed in dark pink and brown inks, for lecture and discussion series at The Detroit Institute of Arts, designed to be mailed. 
Recto: Five text blocks of dark pink and brown typeface moves in waves across sheet.  Middle triangular segment of text, dark pink, surrounding text, brown. Text describes events of each night, times, admission fees.  Across right edge, one letter in "Lines" next to each text block.  Across lower edge, text giving sponsor and contact inofrmation.  
Verso: Upper two thirds of sheet, two lines of text, printed in brown, giving dates and titles, converge near upper edge.  Across lower third of sheet, text printed in brown giving mailing information.

tombstone.epitaph:
Announcement, Lines: New Writing at the Detroit Institute of Arts, 1985. Offset lithograph on off-white paper. 
Gift of Edward Fella. 1995-42-42
